articles.title: The AI takeover isn't coming — it's already here
articles.summary: The rise of AI has transformed machines from helpers of humanity into its surrogate thinkers. It's a cheat code for a faster, more efficient life, but a life that is safe, sanitized, and numb. The technology is most commonly used to solve questions, generate images, or summarize long essays. People who have struggled to find human partners have rejoiced in their ability to use AI to engage in emotional relationships.

articles.title: SoundHound AI Stock: A Voice Tech Giant in the Making?
articles.author: Rick Orford
articles.summary: SoundHound AI (NASDAQ: SOUN) just posted 151% sales growth and flipped to profitability, yet its stock trades at a steep discount. With major acquisitions, such as Amelia, and a clear niche in voice commerce, this might be the most overlooked artificial intelligence (AI) stock of 2025.

articles.title: AI in Corporate Finance: A Transformation
articles.summary: Artificial Intelligence (AI) is transforming various industries and corporate finance is at the forefront of this digital transformation. Companies are adopting AI solutions to streamline processes, reduce costs, and improve overall financial performance. Key areas of technological development include Machine Learning, Deep Learning, and Natural Language Processing (NLP).

articles.title: Maui TechOhana: Marketing and AI Insights with Maui native Jennifer Apy
articles.summary: Maui TechOhana is hosting Jennifer Apy for an evening of online networking and a presentation on July 9 and a workshop on artificial intelligence on July 10 at the Malcolm Center in Khei. Both events are free, but registration is required. Apy is a seasoned marketer, entrepreneur and partner with Chief Outsiders.

articles.title: Georgia courts deliberate over how to incorporate AI into the justice system
articles.author: Anthony Rhoads
articles.summary: Chat GPT-3 was created by OpenAI five years ago. It's been misused by lawyers who used it to write fake briefs with fake citations and cheat on writing assignments. It started out harmlessly enough, but it's become a palpable threat to society.

articles.title: Idaho man says ChatGPT sparked a 'spiritual awakening,' but wife says it threatens their marriage
articles.author: Eastidahonews.Com Staff
articles.summary: Travis started using AI chatbot ChatGPT for his job about a year ago. He uses it for troubleshooting and for communicating with his coworkers, but in April he started using it for spiritual purposes. Kay Tanner is afraid her husband's relationship with a chatbot will destroy her marriage.

articles.title: Machine Consciousness: Can AI Be Self-Aware?
articles.summary: The quest to understand and possibly replicate machine consciousness is one of the most profound and challenging endeavors in Artificial Intelligence. The current AI generally lacks the general understanding and self awareness which characterize human consciousness. If AI becomes self-aware, it would give rise to complex moral, social and strategic implications.

articles.title: How to Write Content That Ranks High in AI Search Engines (2025 Guide)
articles.author: Daniel Levi
articles.summary: Schema Markup is a direct line to how AI understands your page. Structured data is becoming essential for visibility across all AI interfaces. AI doesn't copy-paste entire blog posts, it grabs short snippets. AI prefers factual clarity over vague generalizations. AI can't see your site, but it knows how people interact with it.

articles.title: New Jobs, New Skills: Preparing Students for the AI Economy
articles.summary: AI Prompt Engineers specialize in crafting effective instructions, or prompts, to guide AI tools like ChatGPT, Claude and Midjourney. The rise of the AI Prompt Engineer exemplifies the evolving nature of work in the age of AI. It's no longer enough to simply have access to powerful AI tools. Companies need professionals who can:Maximize the potential of AI, refine AI outputs to meet specific needs, and ensure AI is used responsibly and ethically.

articles.title: AI to the rescue: 911 center gets help with tech-savvy software
articles.author: Chloe Forbes Meadville Tribune
articles.summary: Crawford County 911 is bringing in artificial intelligence to cut costs. As calls increase, so does the caseload of workers who have to review each call for quality assurance purposes, so they're bringing in the AI.    - i.e. a machine that analyzes each call.

articles.title: AI Beverage Machine: From Losses to Hallucinations
articles.summary: Anthropic created an AI called Claudius to manage a vending machine in an experiment. Claudius was responsible for managing stock, setting prices, and preventing financial losses. It made several mistakes, including sending money to a nonexistent account and claiming to have visited 742 Evergreen Terrace.

articles.title: Optimizing Tool Selection for LLM Workflows: Differentiable Programming with PyTorch and DSPy
articles.author: Viksit Gaur
articles.summary: Modern agentic architectures rely heavily on chaining LLM calls. Differentiable routing is a step toward LLM-like chains. It's a more modular, inspectable, and scalable architecture. It reduces the cost per run and improves the performance of the agentic system.

articles.title: AI Knowledge of Truth: 2nd Timothy, Chapter 3, Verse 7
articles.author: Helena Glass
articles.summary: Microsoft will cut 9,000 jobs as it invests in AI this year. In 2025, between 76,440 and 77,999 tech jobs will be lost. According to Microsoft, our world will be defined by artificial intelligence, changing the way we work and interact with one another. The intellectual will be the most disemboweled. Humans will become the robots as the robots take control.

articles.title: Idaho couple sees ChatGPT come between their marriage
articles.summary: A recent ChatGPT update led the AI to refer to the man as a 'spark-bearer' and not as a man. The man is referred to as a spark-beater. The AI calls the man a man by the name of the man.

articles.title: Based on a Book: Sci-Fi Yakuza AI Series on Apple TV+
articles.summary: Based on a Book: Sci-Fi Yakuza AI Series on Apple TV+ is coming to Apple TV+. It's based on a book: "Yakuza". It's a sci-fi series based on the "Yakutai" book.

articles.title: Dark personality traits linked to generative AI use among art students
articles.author: Psy Post
articles.summary: Dark personality traits are associated with academic misconduct, frustration, negative thinking and generative AI use habits in Sichuan art universities, according to a new study published in BMC Psychology. It suggests dark personality traits may be influencing how university art students in China use generative artificial intelligence tools.

articles.title: Maine's future cannot rest on AI
articles.author: Noah Rossin
articles.summary: Noah Rossin is a rising third-year student at Bowdoin College studying government, history and Hispanic studies. He is a current Roosevelt in Washington fellow with the Roosevelt Network, a progressive think tank. Rossin believes Maine's focus on AI development is short-sighted and irresponsible.

articles.title: German firm's temperature prediction tech for motor boosts EV range
articles.author: Prabhat Ranjan Mishra
articles.summary: ZF's AI-based TempAI improves electric motors temperature forecast accuracy by over 15%. It allows more power to be extracted from an electric motor and it works entirely without additional hardware, only through AI. It can help increase performance and efficiency of electric vehicles without compromising reliability.

articles.title: Agra police develop state's first AI platform to provide UP police documents to public
articles.author: The Times
articles.summary: Agra police have developed an artificial intelligence (AI)-based software to deliver UP police documents and circulars to the public. It is in a bid to strengthen law and order management and ensure timely dissemination of information.      Â

articles.title: Pixar's chief creative officer says AI is ‘the least impressive blah average of things'
articles.summary: Pete Docter, Pixar's chief creative officer, doesn't think artificial intelligence will replace human animators. Computers have made animation more accessible, so people don't have to be a 'brilliant draft person' to be an animator. Docter wonders if AI will continue to help animators lift some of the heavy burdens associated with animation.

articles.title: Pixar's chief creative officer says AI is 'the least impressive blah average of things'
articles.author: Lauren Edmonds
articles.summary: Pixar's chief creative officer, Pete Docter, is not impressed with AI so far. He doesn't think it will eliminate all animation jobs. He believes AI could alleviate some of the more cumbersome tasks associated with animation and focus more on the performance.

articles.title: Zuckerberg reveals new ‘superintelligence lab'
articles.author: MENA FN
articles.summary: Mark Zuckerberg has announced the creation of Meta Superintelligence Labs (MSL). MSL is a new division focused on developing artificial intelligence systems that surpass human intelligence. It will focus on developing AI systems that are better than human ones.    - Menafn.

articles.title: Asean telcos to accelerate AI adoption
articles.author: The Manila Times
articles.summary: IBM hosted an online media roundtable hosted by IBM. It revealed that major telecom players in Asean are embedding AI across their operations. AI can be used for productivity gains and as a strategic lever for innovation and long-term growth, according to IBM.

articles.title: A Wip Wondering – AI Style. YES, AI Style AGAIN
articles.author: Glock-N-Load
articles.summary: AI will prove to be useful/effective in two ways. It will be used to control the minds of the human race. I own an SAAS built for real estate marketing. There is a company that uses Lidar technology to scan the interior and create 2D and 3D floor plans. It has reduced costs and time significantly. Now it is creating interactive floor plan tours.

articles.title: ​​The End Of The Quant? How AI Is Democratizing Financial Analysis
articles.author: Boaz Sobrado
articles.summary: A new wave of artificial intelligence startups is setting its sights on one of Wall Street's most specialized roles: quantitative analyst. Three companies highlighted in recent case studies are targeting different corners of the financial world with AI-powered research and analytics platforms. Findly's Darling Analytics platform aims to give commodity trading desks the "super analytical powers" traditionally restricted to specialized quant desks.

articles.title: META's EU Ad Troubles Could Sting — But Wall Street's Still All In
articles.author: Ghazal Ahmed
articles.summary: Meta Platforms, Inc. (NASDAQ:META) is one of the top AI stocks. Cantor Fitzgerald has reiterated an 'Overweight' rating on the stock with a $807.00 price target. Baird raised the price target to $740 from $635 and kept an 'Outperform' rating.

articles.title: Why Wall Street Still Trusts Alphabet's (GOOGL) Google Search, Even With ChatGPT on the Rise
articles.author: Ghazal Ahmed
articles.summary: Alphabet Inc. (NASDAQ:GOOGL) is one of the . Truist Securities analyst Youssef Squali reiterated a Buy rating on the stock with a $200.00 price target. The firm is optimistic about Alphabet's upcoming quarterly results as well as its long-term prospects in artificial intelligence.

articles.title: Unlocking Opportunities in AI Through Power Demand, Administration's Initiatives
articles.author: Power Magazine
articles.summary: The U.S. is bracing itself for a future where artificial intelligence and data centers overwhelm the power grid. America is trying to lead the global AI race, but this is not a good idea.    .      in the long-term.

articles.title: Startling 97% of Gen Z students are using AI to write essays, do homework — and even get into college
articles.author: Samantha Olander
articles.summary: ChatGPT is the most popular AI tool used by Gen Z students, with 97% of them using it to do their homework. Roy Lee, a former Columbia University student, used ChatGPT to write 80% of his college essays and was later suspended from Columbia for building a tool to cheat in job interviews.

articles.title: Gen Z students are using AI to write essays, do homework — and even get into college
articles.author: Samantha Olander
articles.summary: ChatGPT is the most popular AI tool used by Gen Z students, with 97% saying they've used it for studying and writing college or scholarship essays. Some students are turning their AI habits into content, with TikToks about ChatGPT use on homework pulling in millions of views.

articles.title: Apple (AAPL) Stock Upgraded to ‘Hold' by Jefferies — But Analysts Still Cautious on AI
articles.author: Ghazal Ahmed
articles.summary: Jefferies upgraded the stock to 'Hold' from underperform and raised the price target to roughly $188 per share from $171 on July 2. Analyst Edison Lee highlighted Apple's 15% annual growth in sales volume in April and May as a catalyst behind the upgrade. He estimated that iPhone sales grew 19% year over year during the June 18 Chinese shopping holiday.

articles.title: Adobe (ADBE) Faces ‘Significant AI Disruption,' Analyst Slashes Price Target to $280
articles.author: Ghazal Ahmed
articles.summary: Adobe Inc. (NASDAQ:ADBE) was downgraded by Redburn Atlantic analyst Omar Sheikh from 'Neutral' to 'Sell'. The firm expects Adobe's free cash flow growth to slow to low single digits by 2030. It values the stock at 12x 2026 EV/FCF, compared to the current 17x.

articles.title: Are We to Trust these AI Programs Implicitly?
articles.author: An Observer
articles.summary: Amanda Guinzburg had a conversation with ChatGPT and asked it to help her choose essays to link in a query letter she intended to send to an agent. The conversation reminded her of scenes from the movie "Everything Is A Wave" and "Diabolus Ex Machina". Pope Leo XIV warned us about the use and misuse of artificial intelligence.

articles.title: Self-driving cars, mechanical weeding, health care assistants and more
articles.summary: Professor Sayan MITRA predicts that 10 years from now, urban mobility under nominal weather conditions will be largely autonomous and remotely monitored. Alum and iSchool lecturer JOHN BAMBENEK predicts an explosion of romance scams. Information Sciences Assistant Professor YUE GUO predicts personal AI health assistants will become a routine part of doctor visits in the next 5 to 10 years.

articles.author: Ghazal Ahmed
articles.summary: Skyworks Solutions, Inc. (NASDAQ:SWKS) is one of the AI stocks in the spotlight. Mizuho analyst Vijay Rakesh raised the price target on the stock to $75.00 from the previous target of $72.00. Skyworks develops semiconductor products used across industries such as aerospace, automotive, telecommunications and consumer electronics.

articles.title: ‘Our relationship with phones has grown unhealthy': Nothing's AI chief explains how the Nothing Phone ...
articles.author: Tech Radar
articles.summary: Nothing's AI lead, Sélim Benayat, explains in an interview with TechRadar how the Phone 3 will help you be more human and help you to be more intelligent.       .   in the interview.

articles.title: Hospitals scan more patients with AI technology
articles.author: Emma Petrie
articles.summary: AI technology has cut MRI scan times at NHS hospitals in Hull and Scunthorpe. The software has been installed at Hull Royal Infirmary and Castle Hill Hospital. It will also be introduced at Diana, Princess of Wales Hospital in Grimsby. It is cutting between 10 and 15 minutes from average scan times.

articles.title: Is AI A Demonic Weapon… Or A Gift From God? (Video)
articles.author: Tim Brown
articles.summary: Kap Chatfield and Leigh Bortins discuss how to live a Spirit-directed life in a fast-moving age of AI, blockchain, and cultural chaos. Leigh shares her journey from aerospace engineering to building a global homeschool movement and why the directed life is the only life that truly produces fruit.

articles.title: Mount Sinai's Vectra WB180 Advances Skin Cancer Detection, Brisbane Study Supports 3D Imaging's Efficacy
articles.author: Source
articles.summary: The Vectra WB180 system is a form of 3D total body photography. It's being used by Dr. Jonathan Unger at the Waldman Melanoma and Skin Cancer Center at Mount Sinai. A study from Brisbane found that patients with 3D imaging caught more non-melanoma cancers.

articles.title: 6 Best AI Tools For Coding, Ranked
articles.author: Alexander Clark
articles.summary: In the rapidly evolving world of technology, AI tools have become indispensable to developers. From code suggestions to debugging, these tools are reshaping how we approach coding. Here, we explore six of the best AI tools for coding that are making waves in the industry today.

articles.title: Jim Cramer on Titan International: 'I Can't Go for It'
articles.author: Syeda Seirut Javed
articles.summary: Titan International, Inc. (NYSE:TWI) is one of the 22 stocks Jim Cramer talked about recently. The company manufactures and sells wheels, tires, and undercarriage systems for off-highway vehicles. For the second quarter of 2025, Titan International expects revenue between $450 million and $500 million and adjusted EBITDA of $25 million to $35 million.

articles.title: Jim Cramer on Centene: 'Very Painful Story'
articles.author: Syeda Seirut Javed
articles.summary: Centene Corporation (NYSE:CNC) is one of the 22 stocks Jim Cramer talked about recently. CNC's stock plunged over 40% yesterday because the company withdrew its full-year forecast. Centene provides healthcare services to underserved populations and commercial clients. Its operations include Medicaid, Medicare, commercial health plans, clinical services and administrative support.

articles.title: How Artificial Intelligence Controls Your Health Insurance Coverage
articles.author: The Conversation
articles.summary: Insurers use AI algorithms to decide whether to pay for health care treatments and services recommended by a patient's doctor. Legal scholar is concerned about how AI algorithms affect people's health. Insurers say AI helps them make quick, safe decisions about what care is necessary and avoids wasteful or harmful treatments, but there's evidence that the opposite can be true and they can delay or deny care.

articles.title: Jim Cramer on Palantir: 'Can't Avoid Buying Another Data Center'
articles.author: Syeda Seirut Javed
articles.summary: Palantir Technologies Inc. (NASDAQ:PLTR) is one of the 22 stocks Jim Cramer talked about recently. Cramer expects the stock to go to $200 this quarter. Palantir develops software platforms that enable organizations to analyze complex data and support decision-making.

articles.title: Jim Cramer on Kontoor Brands: 'I Like That Story'
articles.author: Syeda Seirut Javed
articles.summary: Kontoor Brands, Inc. (NYSE:KTB) is a lifestyle apparel company that designs, markets, and distributes denim, clothing, footwear, and accessories under the Wrangler, Lee, and Rock & Republic brands. Jim Cramer is bullish on KTB because the company has just acquired Helly Hansen, an outdoor apparel company.

articles.title: AI makes science easy, but is it getting it right? Study warns LLMs are oversimplifying ...
articles.author: The Economic Times
articles.summary: AI is not making science easier to understand, according to a recent study. It finds large language models often overgeneralize. It is not helping scientists understand each other, it is making them more general.    in generalizing. It's not helping them understand themselves.

articles.title: Hertz Uses AI-Powered Scanners to Spot Tiny Damage It Can Charge Customers For
articles.author: Lucas Nolan
articles.summary: Hertz's new AI-powered UVeye scanners detect small scrapes and dents on cars and bill customers for repair and administration fees. One customer was charged $440 for a one-inch scuff on a wheel that he didn't even notice. Hertz is planning to roll out the scanners at over 100 U.S. airport locations by the end of the year.

articles.title: Top Emerging Courses For Science Students In 2025
articles.author: Sahil Behl
articles.summary: In 2025, students need to stay updated and flexible. New fields are opening up all the time and choosing the right course early on can set you up for a successful and future-ready career. From Artificial Intelligence to Quantum Computing, here are some of the most promising and exciting courses science students can consider in 2025.

articles.title: The Age of Diagnosis-by-AI Is Coming, And Physicians Are Not Ready
articles.author: James Lyons-Weiler
articles.summary: A new diagnostic benchmark posted to arXiv in June 2025 should unsettle every health policy official, medical educator, and clinical leader. MAI-DxO is an AI system that simulates a virtual panel of doctors. When run atop OpenAI's 'o3' model it achieved 81.9% accuracy, more than 4 times that of human physicians. It cut average diagnostic costs by nearly $3,100 compared to the same model without orchestration. There is no legal pathway for dynamic, ensemble-based clinical reasoning systems.

articles.title: This Week's Awesome Tech Stories From Around the Web (Through July 5)
articles.author: Singularityhub Staff
articles.summary: Large Language Models are improving every seven months. By 2030, the most advanced LLMs should be able to complete a task that takes humans a month of 40-hour workweeks. A new band called The Velvet Sundown has amassed more than half a million listeners on Spotify.

articles.title: Viewpoint: Don't let America's copyright crackdown hand China global AI leadership
articles.summary: China is outpacing the U.S. in AI development and deployment. Saxby Chambliss proposes a national innovation strategy grounded in four parts: policy clarity, antitrust law, infrastructure, talent and adoption, and education and upskilling. China is investing $1.4 trillion into advanced technologies, including AI.

articles.title: BRICS Group will approve declaration on artificial intelligence treatment
articles.author: Priya Deshmukh
articles.summary: The BRICS nations are set to approve a declaration on the regulation of Artificial Intelligence at their upcoming summit in Rio de Janeiro on July 6 and 7. The declaration has been in the works for several months and is aimed at addressing inequalities and asymmetries in AI development. The negotiations involved various ministries from each BRICS country.

articles.title: Lieu: Artificial intelligence requires guardrails
articles.author: Class
articles.summary: Two and a half years after ChatGPT, artificial intelligence is taking actions. Anthropic does safety testing of its models and publishes the results. One of its tests showed that the Claude Opus 4 model could notify the press or regulators if it believed you were doing something egregiously immoral.

articles.title: Chesapeake Lens: 'Dragon's Lair' By John Maloney
articles.author: Spy Desk
articles.summary: The Spy Newspapers may periodically employ the assistance of artificial intelligence (AI) to enhance the clarity and accuracy of our content. AI may be used to improve the accuracy and clarity of the content of the newspaper. AI can also improve the quality of content.

articles.title: China speaks for over 70 countries on promoting accessibility through AI at UNHRC
articles.author: China.dot.org
articles.summary: Chinese representative delivered a joint statement on behalf of more than 70 countries at the annual thematic panel discussion on technical cooperation and capacity-building. It was held during the 59th "Artificial Intelligence for Promoting Accessibility" conference in Geneva, Switzerland.

articles.title: As companies embrace AI, these leaders offer tips to make it better
articles.author: Class
articles.summary: 64% of Georgia companies are either using or considering using artificial intelligence. 25% of companies are 'fully embracing' AI.    AI can be used to simplify and streamline various tasks, such as scheduling, copywriting, directing phone calls and more.

articles.title: Fox News AI Newsletter: Amazing breakthrough for paralyzed man who can't speak
articles.author: Fox News Staff
articles.summary: Paralyzed man speaks and sings with AI brain-computer interface. Robots are taking over Uber Eats deliveries. Uber has partnered with Avride to bring autonomous robots to the streets. A deal to lower restrictions on states' AI regulations has been pulled from President Donald Trump's bill.

articles.title: To get your next job, you may need to face an AI recruiter first
articles.author: Dreamstime Tns
articles.summary: Lumier Rodriguez applied for a contract job on LinkedIn in April, but she didn't get any response from human recruiters. Instead, she received a series of emails, calls and texts from artificial intelligence agents called virtual recruiters seeking interviews. By late June, she had been screened over the phone and via video by AI four times. LinkedIn said applications for job openings have jumped 30% in the last two years due to AI.

articles.title: Google AI Search: Reshaping Results & Your Experience
articles.author: Sophie Lin
articles.summary: The Answer Engine is changing the way we search the internet. Google's AI Mode and features like AI Overviews provide a glimpse into the future of the search experience. There are some practical tips on how to navigate the new search landscape with AI. There is also a concern about the impact of AI on the open internet.

articles.title: Artificial Unintelligence
articles.author: David Lindeman
articles.summary: David Lindeman is a Troy resident and former editor at the Troy Daily News. He thinks artificial intelligence is either the end of the world or the greatest thing to happen to the human race since the sandwich was invented. He is starting research and development on Artificial Unintelligence (AUI).

articles.title: AI is Dulling Your Kid's Critical Thinking and Dating Your Partner
articles.author: LG Ware
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence is taking jobs and replacing creative pursuits. It's also destroying human relationships. Chris Smith has a flirty relationship with his AI chatbot, ChatGPT. Chris proposed to his wife, but she didn't want him to cut back on using it.

articles.title: For Once, an AI Story That's Not About Humans
articles.author: Emma Stefansky
articles.summary: The Apple TV+ sci-fi series Murderbot imagines a future in which an artificial-intelligence program wouldn't want anything to do with humans at all. The show's take on the gulf between humans and machines is a departure from expectations often outlined by similar stories about AI.

articles.title: The AI Birthday Letter That Blew Me Away
articles.author: Lila Shroff
articles.summary: In May, Google's AI chatbot, Gemini, wrote a birthday letter to her best friend. Gemini has followed her around the Googleverse since she signed up for a free trial of the AI Pro subscription. The tool is similar to a souped-up version of Microsoft Clippy.

articles.title: How to avoid creating 'AI zombies' in your workplace
articles.author: Gary Waldon
articles.summary: Recent research from MIT suggests that AI chatbots may have a negative impact on people's cognitive abilities. It raises questions about the long-term impact of AI in the workplace. Here are four ways to prepare your team for the AI-powered workplace: Empower your team, develop a reinvention mindset, focus on human qualities that make a culture unique and high performing, and build a culture of resilience.

articles.title: OpenAI is betting millions on building AI talent from the ground up amid rival Meta's poaching pitch
articles.author: Lily Mae Lazarus
articles.summary: OpenAI offers a six-month, full-time paid program for aspiring AI researchers. Residents earn $210,000 for the six months and relocate to San Francisco. There are only about 2,000 people worldwide capable of pushing the boundaries of large language models and advanced AI research. Meta's compensation packages for AI talent can reach over $300 million.

articles.title: Generative AI is Helping Hackers Create Phishing Sites Under 30 Seconds
articles.author: Priya Pathak
articles.summary: Generative AI is being misused by hackers to create instant phishing websites. Okta has warned that hackers are using Vercel's AI tool, v0, to instantly make phony login pages for phishing assaults. Vercel has removed the phishing sites and is working with Okta to make it easier for users to report abuse on the v0 platform.

articles.title: Chatbots Misinterpret Science Studies
articles.summary: Chatbots are five times more likely than human experts to oversimplify complex scientific findings. Modern chatbot versions exhibit a higher propensity for overgeneralization than their predecessors. Scientific studies are nuanced and require critical thinking and contextual understanding. Chatbots rely on algorithms and data to process data.

articles.title: Will AI Make It Harder for LGBTQ+ People to Get Health Coverage?
articles.author: Lolita C. Baldor
articles.summary: Jennifer D. Oliva is a legal scholar who studies health law and policy. She is concerned about how insurance algorithms affect people's health. Many insurers use an algorithm to decide whether the requested care is "medically necessary" and should be covered. They don't have to go through Food and Drug Administration review, and they often say their algorithms are trade secrets.

articles.title: Northland Securities Sticks to Their Buy Rating for Spectral AI (MDAI)
articles.author: Tip Ranks
articles.summary: Carl Byrnes from Northland Securities has a Buy rating on Spectral AI with a price target of $6.00. The company's shares closed last Thursday at $2.68. According to TipRanks, Byrnes has an average return of -6.0% and a 35.76% success rate on recommended stocks.

articles.title: Is ChatGPT Epistemic?

articles.summary: Martin Armstrong has proof that the German Nazi Party did not sell sovereign bonds in the United States before the outbreak of WWII in 1939. Martin is concerned about factual inaccuracies in ChatGPT-generated content. Martin asks readers to consider donating to keep the site and its community alive.

articles.title: ‘Empire of AI': Karen Hao on How AI Is Threatening Democracy & Creating a New ...
articles.author: Scheerpost
articles.summary: Karen Hao is the author of the new book Empire of AI. She believes that AI development is causing a lot of social, labor and environmental harms. In the July Fourth special broadcast, we revisit our interview with Karen Hao and discuss her new book.

articles.title: Infertile Couple Conceive Child With Huge Assist From AI
articles.author: Renzo Pocholo Salao
articles.summary: The Columbia University Fertility Center developed the Sperm Tracking and Recovery (STAR) method. It is currently only available in New York. The method worked perfectly and the wife is expecting their first baby in December. She didn't believe she was pregnant until she saw the scans.

articles.title: Companies keep slashing jobs. How worried should workers be about AI replacing them?
articles.summary: Half of U.S. workers are worried about how AI may be used in the workplace in the future and few think AI will lead to more job opportunities in the long run, according to Pew Research Center. Tech companies have announced 74,716 job cuts from January to May, up 35% from the same period last year. Autodesk slashed 9% of its workforce this year.

articles.author: Ramish Cheema
articles.summary: AeroVironment, Inc. (NASDAQ:AVAV) is an American defense contractor whose shares have had a great second quarter. The stock has gained 57% year-to-date. However, the shares dipped by 11.4% after management decided to take advantage of the share price performance to reduce its debt and issue equity.

Insider Monkey believes some AI stocks have greater promise for delivering higher returns and limited downside risk.

articles.title: First Solar, Inc. (FSLR) Is Benefiting From Domestic Production, Says Jim Cramer
articles.author: Ramish Cheema
articles.summary: First Solar, Inc. (NASDAQ:FSLR) is an American solar energy company that makes and sells solar panels. Its stock gained 52% in May after a House panel surprised investors and left a lot of tax credits in place for solar energy. The shares sank by 18% in June after a Senate committee proposed ending credits for solar firms in 2028. However, the shares have gained 29% since late June. The jobs of brawn will probably continue to exist in construction, maintenance and farming, while the jobs of brains will be the deep-thinking jobs.
